arm_group.description: tympanoplasty -- conchal cavum approach is used.

brief_summary.textblock:
Tympanoplasty -- conchal cavum approach is a modification of Heermann endural approach to
      repair broken eardrums. The Heermann approach is a well recognized procedure, in common
      clinical practise for years.

      The new approach has been used in patients after informed consent was obtained from each
      patient.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tympanoplasty Using Conchal Cavum Approach and Conchal Pericondrium

detailed_description.textblock:
From 2010 to 2013, a total of 96 patients had the procedure. The data are entered, and
      analyzed. All identifiable information would be hidden.

      This application is to obtain patients' consent for release and publication of the data.
      Patients would be assured their identities are protected.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All patients with informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients without consent

intervention.description: Incision is made inside the ear canal. It is extended into the conchal cavum. The incision allows a direct approach to the eardrum, and also allow easy harvesting of the perichondrium to be used as graft material.

primary_outcome.measure: success rate of repair of eardrum

reference.citation: Mohamad SH, Khan I, Hussain SS. Is cartilage tympanoplasty more effective than fascia tympanoplasty? A systematic review. Otol Neurotol. 2012 Jul;33(5):699-705. doi: 10.1097/MAO.0b013e318254fbc2. Review.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Clinical instructor, division of ENT, department of surgery, UBC

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
